title: Non Condensed Impact All Caps
content:
Trying to determine what font was used in the text "North Dakota Nurse Association." It appears to be a variant of Impact that is not condensed. Any suggestions? Bonus if anyone knows what the primary font was used in the main logo.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416020738im_/http:/typophile.com/files/NDNA-LOGO_4270.png)
author: kwmnitram

comments.content:
The full name may be an artificially squashed and widened Akzidenz Grotesk Extra Bold:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/akzidenz-grotesk-be/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416020738/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/akzidenz-grotesk-be/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/akzidenz-grotesk-be/")

I suspect that |NDNA| is the same, with modifications (rounding corners, inline detail, alter the |A|).

Helvetica Black Condensed with similar manipulation also gets you close:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416020738/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica/")
